page.title: 02BEXLEYHEATH TRANSPORT (RAIL)
page.content: The Bexleyheath railway opened in 1895 as part of the North Kent line built by South Eastern Railway. Travellers in the 1890's would have seen wide open spaces with a few houses dotted about. They would also have seen the farm labourers working in the orchards and glass houses. People travelling from Bexleyheath in the 1980's see a very different scene. Houses,gardens, shops, offices and factories have developed along the line. Most of the open space has gone. Most of the train passengers are travelling towards London for work or shopping. The journey takes about 35 minutes. Although many people are satisfied with the service, others wanted to see cleaner and more comfortable trains. Many people walk to the station but those who drive want larger car parks.
